result.execSummary:
The defendant James A. Fischer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (>1000-2500g), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

timeConds.notes: Defendant is entitled to Huber Privileges. No Good Time Credit.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James A. Fischer

Photos given to the court by DA Blader at the September 28, 2015 Plea/sentencing hearing

Case called @ 3:07 p.m. Defendant James A. Fischer in court with attorney Thomas W. Kurzynski.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Kurzynski. Defendant waives his right to a PSI being prepared. Statement by DE. Court orders: S/W 3 years probation - Conditions: 90 days WCJ - Huber, No GT, No CFTS - Sentence to commence by no later than 12-1-2015, AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Appeal rights given.

Pre-trial conference at 04-15-2015 02:15 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.   Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

Case Called @ 1:10 PM: Defendant James A. Fischer in court with attorney Thomas W. Kurzynski.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  Court entertains waiver of pre-lim hearing in its entirety.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of pre-lim hearing.  Def BOT with probable cause finding.  ARGN to proceed.  INFO Filed.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  NGP received and entered.  DA argues for $1000 Signature Bond.  No objection by defense.  PTC/STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Court entertains wavier of any potential conflict of defense counsel with Defendant, as his attorney will be representing his wife Bonnie Fischer as well.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of any conflict of interest as to dual representation of his wife, Bonnie, by Attorney Kurzynski.  Further determines as postured today - no inherent conflict in the dual representation - Court will permit dual representation.  Written waiver filed by Atty Kurzynski.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 02:15 pm.  Status conference scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
